name: Gem_Sirrom
content:
Gem Sirrom was a human female senator of the Galactic Republic's Senate, where she was an ally of fellow Senator Padm√© Amidala. Shortly after the end of the Clone Wars in 19 BBY, Sirrom took part in Amidala's funeral procession, walking behind the coffin with a group of other senators as it passed through the city of Theed on the planet Naboo. Sirrom wore a red dress to the funeral and had light skin, brown hair, and brown eyes.
Gem Sirrom appeared in the 2005 prequel trilogy film, Star Wars: Episode III Revenge of the Sith. The funeral scene that featured the character was filmed at Fox Studios, Sydney on September 16, 2003. Earlier in the film, an Opera House patron played by Jill Brooks can be seen wearing the same outfit as Sirrom.
In the current Star Wars canon, Sirrom was identified in the 2017 reference book Star Wars: The Visual Encyclopedia. The name originated in the Star Wars Legends continuity, where it was first used in an entry for the character in the StarWars.com Databank, which had been published by 2010.
